🚀 𝗙𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗦𝘁𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗰 𝘁𝗼 𝗗𝘆𝗻𝗮𝗺𝗶𝗰 𝗜𝗮𝗖: 𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗡𝗲𝘅𝘁 𝗟𝗲𝗮𝗽 𝗶𝗻 𝗗𝗲𝘃𝗢𝗽𝘀 🚀 🤔 How can DevOps evolve from static IaC to truly dynamic systems that learn from production? 🔍 𝗜𝗻 𝘁𝗼𝗱𝗮𝘆'𝘀 𝗜𝗮𝗖 𝘀𝘆𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗺𝘀: ➡️ Configs are set during dev/test ➡️ Configs are maintained as-is in production 🌟 𝗜𝗺𝗮𝗴𝗶𝗻𝗲 𝗮 𝘄𝗼𝗿𝗹𝗱 𝘄𝗵𝗲𝗿𝗲: ✅ Configs update based on production insights ✅ IaC remains the source of truth ✅ Engineers focus on core product features 🎥 Watch the video to see how Sedai's Hari Chandrasekhar and KnowBe4's Nate Singletary made this world a reality 💪: 1️⃣ 𝗞𝗻𝗼𝘄𝗕𝗲𝟰'𝘀 𝗖𝗜/𝗖𝗗 𝗦𝘆𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗺: Nate explains their GitLab-based setup and Sedai integration 2️⃣ 𝗥𝗲𝘀𝘂𝗹𝘁𝘀: 𝟯𝟳% potential cloud cost savings, 𝟭𝟬% already realized 💰 by dynamically adjusting configs across 9K services - without engineers being pulled in to make IaC changes (starts at 1:39 in the video) 3️⃣ 𝗜𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗴𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗢𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀: Hari outlines 4 ways to combine autonomous optimization with IaC (starts at 2:13) 🔮 𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗕𝗶𝗴𝗴𝗲𝗿 𝗣𝗶𝗰𝘁𝘂𝗿𝗲: Dynamic IaC with feedback loops is just the first step towards AI-augmented, autonomous DevOps where engineers innovate while AI continually optimizes the DevOps lifecycle and handles routine tasks. 🚀 Intrigued by dynamic IaC's potential to deliver immediate cost and time savings? CI/CD and IaC revolutionized DevOps. Let's master the fundamentals with Hari Chandrasekhar, VP Engineering Core at Sedai. In this insightful video, Hari provides a rapid fire primer on CI/CD, Infrastructure as Code, and GitOps - an essential foundation for understanding how autonomous systems take IaC to the next level, a topic we'll be discussing in the coming days. Here are the key takeaways: 🔄 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗻𝘂𝗼𝘂𝘀 𝗜𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗴𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗻𝘂𝗼𝘂𝘀 𝗗𝗲𝗽𝗹𝗼𝘆𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁 (𝗖𝗜/𝗖𝗗) Hari defines CI/CD as a method to frequently deliver applications by automating various stages of development. This approach has become a cornerstone of modern software practices. Popular CI/CD tools: 🔹 Jenkins 🔹 Argo 🔹 CircleCI 🔹 GitLab CI/CD Benefits of CI/CD: 🔹 Reduced manual errors 🔹 Decreased lead times 🔹 Faster release rates 🏗️ 𝗜𝗻𝗳𝗿𝗮𝘀𝘁𝗿𝘂𝗰𝘁𝘂𝗿𝗲 𝗮𝘀 𝗖𝗼𝗱𝗲 (𝗜𝗮𝗖): 𝗧𝗿𝗮𝗻𝘀𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗜𝗻𝗳𝗿𝗮𝘀𝘁𝗿𝘂𝗰𝘁𝘂𝗿𝗲 𝗠𝗮𝗻𝗮𝗴𝗲𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁 Building on CI/CD principles,IaC involves describing and managing infrastructure components using code-based configuration files. A core IaC concept is to define "What It Should Be" (WISB) as code, replacing manual processes with programmatic approaches. Some popular IaC tools: 🔹 Terraform 🔹 Ansible 🔹 AWS Cloud Development Kit 🔹 Puppet 🔹 Helm IaC advantages: 🔹 Declarative infrastructure definition 🔹 Reproducible environments 🔹 Auditable changes 🔀 𝗚𝗶𝘁𝗢𝗽𝘀: 𝗠𝗲𝗿𝗴𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗚𝗶𝘁 𝗪𝗼𝗿𝗸𝗳𝗹𝗼𝘄𝘀 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗻𝘂𝗼𝘂𝘀 𝗗𝗲𝗽𝗹𝗼𝘆𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁 Hari covers GitOps as an extension of version control principles to infrastructure and deployment management, creating a seamless integration between development and operations. Typical GitOps workflow for Kubernetes: 1️⃣ Developers commit code to a source repository 2️⃣ CI/CD pipeline processes the code 3️⃣ Docker image created and pushed to registry 4️⃣ GitOps repo updated with new values 5️⃣ Continuous Deployment tool (e.g., Argo CD) syncs changes 6️⃣ Changes deployed across Kubernetes clusters 🚀 𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗣𝗼𝘄𝗲𝗿 𝗼𝗳 𝗜𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗴𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 By combining CI/CD, Infrastructure as Code, and GitOps, Hari highlights that organizations can achieve: 🔹 Faster and more reliable deployments 🔹 Consistent and version-controlled infrastructure 🔹 Improved collaboration between development and operations teams Stay tuned for our upcoming posts where we'll explore the difference between automated and autonomous systems and how autonomous systems are taking Infrastructure as Code to the next level. #CICD #DevOps #InfrastructureAsCode #GitOps #AutoCon23 #AIinDevOps #PlatformEngineering

🛠️ 𝗙𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗥𝗲𝗽𝗼𝗿𝘁𝘀 𝘁𝗼 𝗥𝗲𝘀𝘂𝗹𝘁𝘀: 𝗛𝗼𝘄 𝗙𝗶𝗻𝗢𝗽𝘀 𝘁𝗲𝗮𝗺𝘀 𝘂𝘀𝗲 𝗔𝗜 𝘁𝗼 𝗖𝘂𝘁 𝗖𝗹𝗼𝘂𝗱 𝗖𝗼𝘀𝘁𝘀 🛠️ The world of FinOps is evolving, and AI is enabling an exciting new era for cloud cost optimization. Curious about your potential savings? By the end of this post, you'll see how companies are cutting cloud costs by up to 50% - and how you can assess your own savings opportunity. We're moving into the third era of FinOps: 📊 𝗥𝗲𝗽𝗼𝗿𝘁𝘀 𝗘𝗿𝗮 (2012+): "What did we spend last month?" 📝 𝗥𝗲𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗺𝗲𝗻𝗱𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀 𝗘𝗿𝗮 (2016+): "We need to validate these proposed rightsizing changes with engineering." 🚀 𝗥𝗲𝘀𝘂𝗹𝘁𝘀 𝗘𝗿𝗮 (2023+): "Tell the AI to minimize cost while hitting our SLOs." Where are you in your FinOps journey through the '3 Rs'? While the 𝗥𝗲𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗺𝗲𝗻𝗱𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀 𝗘𝗿𝗮 gave teams a starting point on where savings may exist, it also came with challenges: ✖️ Backlogs of recommendations ✖️ Slow execution due to scarce engineering bandwidth ✖️ Difficulties staying optimized as new releases make recommendations stale ✖️ Uncertain end-user impacts due to limited consideration of performance and availability Enter the AI-Powered 𝗥𝗲𝘀𝘂𝗹𝘁𝘀 𝗘𝗿𝗮 with these new capabilities: 1️⃣ Continuous Cost Optimization: AI learns and adapts for ongoing savings. 2️⃣ Reduced Engineering Toil: AI autonomously executes optimizations. 3️⃣ Safety & Application Awareness: AI considers performance metrics and SLOs. 𝗥𝗲𝗮𝗹-𝗪𝗼𝗿𝗹𝗱 𝗜𝗺𝗽𝗮𝗰𝘁: KnowBe4, a leading security awareness platform, implemented AI-based optimization and saw remarkable results: 💰 Up to 50% cost savings in production & 87% in development ✅ Zero incidents 🏆 Improved customer experience ⏱️ Reduced engineering toil The future of FinOps is here, and it's powered by AI. Gartner predicts that "By 2026, organizations performing real-time cost or performance optimization of cloud-based workloads will rise from less than 20% in 2022 to 50%." 🧱 𝗪𝗵𝗲𝗻 𝗙𝗶𝗻𝗢𝗽𝘀 𝗛𝗶𝘁𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗪𝗮𝗹𝗹 🧱 As FinOps teams mature, they often hit a wall after easy cost savings are captured. Finding material new savings becomes increasingly difficult, and the prior approach of utilizing reports and recommendations combined with manual engineering effort to execute no longer scales. At this stage, augmented or autonomous FinOps can be implemented to set teams up for the next set of cost savings gains. These AI/ML-based systems are capable of finding and executing optimizations across thousands of resources. They operate in a copilot or autopilot mode that reduces engineering bandwidth and use reinforcement learning for continuous improvement so that teams can stay optimized. Watch the video as Sedai's Nikhil Gopinath Kurup covers (a) the challenges that affect teams as they seek to work from reports and recommendations to results and (b) how autonomous approaches let teams tackle the bottlenecks they run into.
